Copy Project/Create Project Database Dialog

Use the Copy Project Database dialog box of Copy Project Database (Edit | Copy) to create a new project database from the project database you selected to copy.

Field Descriptions

Name Enter a name for the project database. The name cannot begin or end with a tab or blank space. Any character can be used in the name.
Location Either enter the location of the project database or click the Browse button and select the location. Do not create project databases in the same location as an existing 5.3/6.0 project root.
Archive Location Either enter the archive location of the project database or click the Browse button and select the location if you want it to be a location other than the default. The default is a directory named archives beneath the project database location. If you do not copy archives to the project location (an option on the next screen), then only new archives will be stored in this directory.
Workfile Location Either enter the workfile location for the project database or click the Browse button and select the location if you want it to be a location other than the default. Workfiles are not copied to the work directory when you copy the project database or project, but will be added to the directory when you check out or get a versioned file. Remember that Users can create private workspaces to change the workfile location to a local drive if they want.
